metadata.title: CVE-2014-0075 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the parseChunkHeader function injava/org/apache/coyote/http11/filters/ChunkedInputFilter.java in ApacheTomcat before 6.0.40, 7.x before 7.0.53, and 8.x before 8.0.4 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption) via amalformed chunk size in chunked transfer coding of a request during thestreaming of data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0075` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.41-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.53-1
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.53-1
tomcat7 - 7.0.53-1
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.53-1
tomcat7-common - 7.0.53-1
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.53-1
tomcat7-user - 7.0.53-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.9-1
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.9-1
tomcat8 - 8.0.9-1
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.9-1
tomcat8-common - 8.0.9-1
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.9-1
tomcat8-user - 8.0.9-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.41-1').
tomcat7 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.53-1').
tomcat8 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.9-1').
